ex3 module¶

BASE FILE for Exercise 3¶

Logistics Regressions for Multiple Classes Neural Networks

ex3.lr_cost_function(theta, X, y, lamda)¶

Returns \(Cost(J) = -y * log(sigmoid(X * \theta)) - (1 - y) * log(1 - sigmoid(X*\theta))\)

Parameters:
  • theta – np.array(D, 1)
  • X – np.array(N, D)
  • y – np.array(N, 1)
  • lamda – float – hyper parameter for regularization strength.
Returns:

float – cost J

Calculate Grad

Parameters:
  • theta – np.array(D, 1)
  • X – np.array(N, D)
  • y – np.array(N, 1)
  • lamda – float – hyper parameter for regularization strength.
Returns:

np.array(D, )
ex3.oneVsAll(X, y, num_labels, lamda, verbose=1)¶

Calculate Theta for multi classes :math: X_0

Parameters:
  • X – np.array(N, D)
  • y – np.array(N, 1)
  • num_labels – int – number of labels
  • lamda – float – for regularization strength
Returns:

np.array(C, D) – all_theta
ex3.predict(Theta1, Theta2, X)¶

Do the forward propagation of given Theta1, Theta2, and X.

Parameters:
  • Theta1 – np.array (given)
  • Theta2 – np.array (given)
  • X – input (given)
Returns:

np.array(N,1) – correct classes

 
>>> predict(Theta1, Theta2, X)
np.array([1,5,2,...])
ex3.predictOneVsAll(all_theta, X)¶

Predict y given X

Note

The bias term(X_0) must be added

Parameters:
  • all_theta (np.array(C, D)) – C classes D dimensions
  • X (np.array(N, D)) – Input Matrix. Bias term should be added before.
Returns:

np.array(N,1) – correct classes
ex3.reshape(x)¶

Simple Helper Function that turns np.array(n, ) to np.array(n, 1)

Parameters:x – np.array(N, )
Returns:np.array(N, 1)
ex3.sigmoid(z)¶

Returns Sigmoid(X)

Parameters:z – any value
Returns:float of the given shape
